question: 亭
sourceMnemonic: If you see the kanji <kanji>restaurant</kanji> attached to a place name, there's a good chance that it's a <vocabulary>restaurant</vocabulary>, especially a <vocabulary>traditional Japanese restaurant</vocabulary>. It also crops up on the end of other places where you can rest, like <vocabulary>inn</vocabulary>s, those traditional <vocabulary>pavilion</vocabulary>s you see in Japanese parks and temple grounds, and <vocabulary>tea house</vocabulary>s.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The reading is the same as the one you learned with the kanji.
